title: On Our Own Ground: The Complete Writings of William Apess, a Pequot
description: "Makes available in a superb scholarly edition not only the first published autobiography by a native American (1829 originally), but also a range of historical, political, and personal writings." -- New York Times Book ReviewWilliam Apess was the first Native American's to fully, and publicly, speak out regarding the racism and unfair treatment that he and others endured. The author's writing is eloquently delivered, instilling the reader with a realistic framework of a political, historical, and personal mindset.
author: William Apess
